TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GenericXmlSecurityToken extends System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken

Docs.summary: Represents a security token that is based upon XML.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> class when you receive a token over the wire that is not defined in a specification or there is no way for you to determine the type of the security token. For example, in a federation scenario when you send a Request Security Token (RST) to a Security Token Service (STS) you do not always know the type of the security token returned by the STS. In such cases, you can use a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> to store the security token as XML along with its internal and external references.
Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> class to define claims using XML when one of the built-in security tokens does not suffice. Other security tokens can define their claims using XML, however the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token generically allows a security token to have an application-defined set of XML.

MemberSignature.Value: public GenericXmlSecurityToken (System.Xml.XmlElement tokenXml, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken proofToken, DateTime effectiveTime, DateTime expirationTime, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause internalTokenReference, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause externalTokenReference, System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy> authorizationPolicies);

Docs.param: An that represents the XML that is associated with the security token. Sets the property.
A that represents the proof token for the security token. Sets the property.
A that represents the first instant in time at which this security token is valid. Sets the property.
A that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid. Sets the property.
A that represents a reference to this security token when it is included in a SOAP message in which it is referenced. Sets the property.
A that represents a reference to this security token when it is not included in a SOAP message in which it is referenced. Sets the property.
A of type that contains the set authorization policies for this security token.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the `internalTokenReference` parameter is `null`, a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause> key identifier clause is created for this security token and set to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference%2A> property.
When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> is obtained in a federation scenario, the proof token contains the key that is encrypted for the client.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AuthorizationPolicies As ReadOnlyCollection(Of IAuthorizationPolicy)

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of authorization policies for this security token.
Docs.value: A of type that contains the set authorization policies for this security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause%60%601> method to determine if a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token can create a specific key identifier. To create the key identifier call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.CreateKeyIdentifierClause%60%601> method.

Docs.typeparam: A that specifies the key identifier to create.
Docs.summary: Creates the specified key identifier clause.
Docs.returns: A that is a key identifier clause for a security token.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference%2A> property or the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ExternalTokenReference%2A> property is returned by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.CreateKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method depending on the type that is passed into the `T` parameter.
Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause%60%601> method to determine if a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token can create a specific key identifier. To create the key identifier call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.CreateKeyIdentifierClause%60%601> method.

Docs.exception: is not and not the same type as one of the or property values.

Docs.summary: Gets a unique identifier of the security token.
Docs.value: The unique identifier of the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token is serialized into XML, the value of the `Id` attribute is set to the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.Id%2A> property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `keyIdentifierClause` parameter is matched against the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ExternalTokenReference%2A> property values using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause.Matches%2A> method on the key identifier clause that is returned by the property values.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ProofToken As SecurityToken

Docs.summary: Gets the proof token for the security token.
Docs.value: A that represents the proof token for the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The proof token is the security token that the requester of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token used for authentication in obtaining the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property SecurityKeys As ReadOnlyCollection(Of SecurityKey)

Docs.summary: Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the proof token.
Docs.value: A of type that contains the set of keys associated with the proof token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The proof token can be obtained by getting the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ProofToken%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TokenXml As XmlElement
public: property System::Xml::XmlElement ^ TokenXml { System::Xml::XmlElement ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the XML that is associated with the security token.
Docs.value: An that represents the XML that is associated with the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token is extensible, so exactly what is contained within the XML is application-dependent.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed
Public Overrides Function ToString () As String

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ToString%2A> method returns the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference%2A>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ExternalTokenReference%2A> properties.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ValidFrom As DateTime
public: virtual property DateTime ValidFrom { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A that represents the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> token is valid. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is specified using the `effectiveTime` parameter of the constructor. The value returned from this property is always in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ValidTo As DateTime
public: virtual property DateTime ValidTo { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> token is valid. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> property is specified using the `expirationTime` parameter of the constructor. The value returned from this property is always in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
